data.title: 28 celebrities who were born in Bergen County
authors: Anthony G. Attrino | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
data.meta_description: Astronaut Wally Schirra, actor John Travolta and journalist Dana Bash are among the celebrities born in Bergen County, N.J.
data.text:
Anthony G. Attrino | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com

via GIPHY

Hometown heroes

Bergen County is not only home to a host of celebrities â€“ it's also the birthplace of many who have gone on to experience fame in movies, television and American culture. From legendary Hollywood actors to sports heroes and even one astronaut, the most populous county in New Jersey has been recorded as their birthplace. Note: NJ Advance Media considered modern celebrities living and dead to compile this list.

John Travolta

Born in Englewood on Feb. 18, 1954, John Travolta dropped out of high school to pursue acting on Broadway and television. In the mid-1970s, Travolta landed the role of Vinnie Barbarino in "Welcome Back, Kotter" and later became a movie superstar in "Grease" and "Saturday Night Fever." After a career lull through the 1980s, Travolta made a comeback in "Pulp Fiction," which led to other highly successful movie projects.

Barbara Corcoran

American business woman, author and "Shark Investor" on ABC-TV's Shark Tank, Barbara Ann Corcoran was born in Edgewater on March 10, 1949. According to her LinkedIn page, Corcoran failed at 22 jobs before borrowing $1,000 from a boyfriend, opening a real-estate office in New York City and building a business worth $6 billion.

(Associated Press file photo)

Tobias Daniels

Born in Englewood Cliffs on Nov. 16, 1982, Tobias Daniels is a Los Angeles-based filmmaker who has been featured on Indiewire and AFROPUNK. He was co-creator of America's first salsa dance video for kids Preferred Choice Award Winning "Salsa with Me." In 2012 he executive produced "Janked" which screened at the Cannes Film Market.

Kevin Jonas

Born Paul Kevin Jonas II in Teaneck on Nov. 5, 1987, Kevin Jonas began teaching himself guitar at age 12 before becoming part of the hit boy band the Jonas Brothers with siblings Joe and Nick. Jonas is the son of a sign-language teacher and a Christian minister. He was raised in Wyckoff.

Tara Reid

Known today for her deep, raspy voice, Tara Reid was born in Wyckoff on Nov. 8, 1975. Her career began at six, when she appeared on a children's game show. She became famous in 1998 for her role as Bunny in "The Big Lebowski."

James Gandolfini

Born on Sept. 18, 1961, in Westwood, James Gandolfini grew up in Park Ridge. A friend of John Travolta's, Gandolfini made his Broadway debut in 1992 and discovered fame in the role of Tony Soprano in the hit HBO series "The Sopranos." Gandolfini died of heart attack on June 19, 2013, at age 51.

Vincent Curatola

Best known for playing Johnny "Sack" Sacramoni in "The Sopranos," Vincent Curatolo was born Aug. 16, 1953 in Englewood. According to his website, Curatolo has stayed close to his New Jersey roots. He was appointed to the New Jersey Hall of Fame and currently serves as a commissioner. Curatolo is also a member of the Hackensack University Medical Center Foundation Board of Trustees.

Debby Boone

The daughter of legendary crooner Pat Boone was born Sept. 22, 1956 in Hackensack. Debby Boone was the third of four daughters who became an overnight singing sensation with the No. 1 single "You Light Up My Life" in 1977. The song earned her a Grammy for Best New Artist.

Bill Parcells

The former head coach of the New York Giants, who led the team to two Super Bowl titles, Bill Parcells was born in Englewood on Aug. 22, 1941. He grew up in Hasbrouck Heights. In addition to the Giants, Parcells served as head coach of the New England Patriots, New York Jets, and Dallas Cowboys.

Dana Bash

CNN's chief political correspondent Dana Bash was born Dana Ruth Schwartz in Montvale on June 15, 1971. She attended Pascack Hills High School and later graduated cum laude with a bachelor's degree in political communications from George Washington University. Bash has been with CNN since joining the organization straight out of college.

Danny Tamberelli

Daniel Paul Tamberelli was born in Wyckoff on Feb. 8, 1982. He attended Ramapo High School in Franklin Lakes and is best known for his roles as Arnold Perlstein in "The Magic School Bus" and Little Pete in "The Adventures of Pete and Pete."

Ricky Nelson

Born Eric Hilliard Nelson in Teaneck on May 8, 1940, Ricky Nelson became an actor and singer-songwriter, recording many of Billboard magazine's Top 10 hits. He starred with his family in "The Adventures of Ozzie and Harriet," and with John Wayne in "Rio Bravo." Nelson died in a plane crash on New Year's Eve in 1985. He was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame on Jan. 21, 1987.

Liv Morgan

Born Gionna Jene Daddio in Paramus on June 8, 1994, Liv Morgan is a professional wrestler and model signed to the WWE. Morgan grew up in Elmwood Park and was discovered at Joe DeFranco and DeFranco's Gym in Wyckoff.

Genie Francis

Born on May 26, 1962 in Englewood, Genie Francis became a regular on the daytime soap "General Hospital" in 1979. In 1981, her character married Tony Geary's character and the televised wedding attracted millions of viewers.

(Wikipedia Commons)

Jacklyn Zeman

Born in Englewood on March 6, 1953, Jacklyn Zeman grew up in Bergenfield and graduated from Bergenfield High School when she was just 15. After studying dance and working as a Playboy Bunny, Zeman became best known for her role as Bobbie Spencer on "General Hospital."

Trish Van Devere

Born Patricia Louise Dressel in Englewood Cliffs on March 9, 1941, Trish Van Devere appeared in 1968 on the soap opera "One Life to Live" before making her mark in Carl Reiner's cult classic film "Where's Poppa?" in 1970. Van Devere was married to George C. Scott from 1972 until his death in 1999.

Ed Harris

Perhaps best known for his gripping role as Jackson Pollock in the Oscar-winning film "Pollock," Ed Harris was born on Nov. 28, 1950 in Englewood Hospital. He was raised in Tenafly and graduated Tenafly High School in 1969. Harris attended Columbia University in New York where he played football before becoming interested in acting.

(AP Photo | Steve Chernin)

Dana Reeve

Born Dana Charles Morosini in Teaneck on March 17, 1961, Dana Reeve became a movie actress who later married Christopher Reeve. Dana Reeve died of lung cancer in Manhattan on March 6, 2006.

Hope Davis

Born March 23, 1964 in Englewood, Hope Davis was raised in Tenafly and graduated with the Class of 1982 at Tenafly High School. As a child, she was friends with another famous New Jersey resident, Mira Sorvino. Davis was nominated in 2012, along with Jeff Daniels, James Gandolfini, Marcia Gay Harden, for a Back Stage Garland Award for Ensemble in "God of Carnage" in Los Angeles.

(Wikipedia Commons)

Graham Clarke

Born in Holy Name Medical Center in Teaneck on July 11, 1970, entertainer and songwriter Graham Clarke spent his early years in Dumont before his family moved to Oradell. Clarke is a popular children's entertainer who adapted an off-center sense of humor. Clarke appears on television often, including during the holidays when he is singing with children.

Lee Meredith

Born Judith Lee Sauls in River Edge on Oct. 22, 1947, Lee Meredith grew up in Fair Lawn. She became an actress known for her movie roles in "The Producers" (1967) and "The Sunshine Boys" (1975). According to IMDB, Meredith has worked in recent years as a teaching assistant at a high school in Bergen County and has also run a dog-sitting business.

Jay Seals

Born March 23, 1976 in Hasbrouck Heights, Jay Seals was also raised there and still visits often. After graduating Ramapo College, Seals headed to Los Angeles, where he became an actor known for his role in "Mad Men" on AMC from 2010-2012. He continues to work in Hollywood as an actor and producer.

Jay Huguley

(Wikipedia Commons)

Tom Wright

Born Harold Thomas Wright in Englewood on Nov. 29, Tom Wright is known for his work on Broadway, in 2002's "Barbershop" and the TV series Seinfeld, where he played Mr. Morgan, Yankees co-worker of character George Costanza.

Charlie Tahan

Born in Glen Rock on June 11, 1998, Charlie Tahan has appeared on movies and in television, perhaps becoming best known for his starring role in the M. Night Shyamalan series "Wayward Pines." Tahan is also known for his work in "I Am Legend," "Charlie St. Cloud," and "Frankenweenie."

(Wikipedia Commons)

Katie Sagona

Born in Westwood on Nov. 26, 1989, Katie Sagona gained early recognition for playing Johnny Depp's daughter in "Donnie Brasco" in 1997. Sagona is a former Ford model and has appeared on Saturday Night Live and Law & Order.

Jamie Donnelly

Born in Teaneck in 1947 (online references do not give a day and date), Jamie Donnelly grew up in New Jersey and did not receive her first big movie role until she was 30 and appeared as Jan, one of the Pink Ladies in the film "Grease." Donnelly has appeared in many roles on television and movies, including a 2009 memorable role as Judge Santa Croce in the TV series "Monk."

(Wikipedia Commons)

Willie Horneff

Born June 12, 1979 in Englewood, Wil Horneff grew up in Saddle River and graduated from Bergen Catholic in Oradell. As a child, Horneff won a Youth in Film Award for his role in 1994's "The Yearling."
